header.title: El Libro de San Cipriano: Libro Completo de Verdadera Magia o El Tesoro del Hechicero
header.category: Western Esotericism, Grimoire Tradition, Ceremonial Magic

central_thesis: This grimoire presents itself as a practical manual for acquiring 'true magic' and absolute dominion over spirits and elements, through rigorous ritual practice, the creation and consecration of specific magical instruments and talismans, and the establishment of formal pacts with both celestial and infernal entities to achieve desires such as wealth, love, invisibility, and power.

structure_content.chapter_title: A LOS FIELES LECTORES
structure_content.summary: The translator, Jonas Sufurino, describes finding and translating an invaluable 'Treatise of True Magic' by a German monk. He emphasizes the book's exceptional importance for acquiring useful knowledge, stressing the need for careful execution of experiments.

structure_content.chapter_title: AL MUNDO TODO
structure_content.summary: Jonas Sufurino recounts his personal journey, culminating in a direct invocation of Lucifer, who, in the year 1001, appeared and delivered the 'catechism of secret sciences,' forming the basis of this book and establishing his relationship with infernal entities.

structure_content.chapter_title: INTRODUCCION. Donde se verá el origen y fundamento de este libro
structure_content.summary: Lucifer bestows upon Jonas Sufurino an indestructible book, explaining its magical properties derived from the 'Red Dragon' and 'Infernal Goat' sigils within, which can animate and pledge servitude to the practitioner.

structure_content.chapter_title: VIDA DE SAN CIPRIANO
structure_content.summary: A biographical sketch of Saint Cyprian, the magician, who initially wielded formidable power over infernal spirits but converted to Christianity after failing to overcome the purity of Justina, whose protection stemmed from the sign of the cross and Lucifer's subjection to the Christian God.

structure_content.chapter_title: PRIMERA PARTE. Libro de San Cipriano o El Tesoro del Hechicero
structure_content.summary: This section serves as a general introduction to the operative principles of the grimoire.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO PRIMERO. Conocimientos necesarios para ejercitar las artes mágicas
structure_content.summary: Details the essential prerequisites for magical practice, including a true vocation, unwavering faith and will, courage, and the selection of consecrated ritual spaces devoid of religious symbols, ideally mountaintops, river crossings, or black-draped rooms.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO II. De los instrumentos que son necesarios para las artes mágicas
structure_content.summary: Provides precise instructions for crafting and consecrating various magical tools, such as white and black-handled knives, swords, daggers, lancets, needles, staves, quills, and wands, each tied to specific planetary hours, materials (e.g., animal blood, plants), and conjurations.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO III. Vestidos de Mágico y modo de prepararlos
structure_content.summary: Outlines the specifications for the magician's attire: white linen, black wool tunic and hood, embroidered with Hebrew characters and divine names in red silk, and white lambskin shoes.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IV. Ceremonial de Mágico
structure_content.summary: Describes the three phases of magical initiation (desire, perseverance, dominion) and the necessity of absolute good faith. It reiterates the requirements for the ritual space and provides cautionary tales, such as the fatal error of Atothas due to a hidden cross.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO V. Cualidades esenciales para profesar las artes mágicas
structure_content.summary: Emphasizes the moral and intellectual virtues required for a magician: genuine desire, meticulous attention to detail, continuous study of natural sciences, strict secrecy, faith, courage, discretion, and unwavering constancy in practice.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VI. Que trata del modo de hacer la tinta con que se han de escribir los pactos, oraciones, etc.
structure_content.summary: Presents an elaborate recipe for magical ink, utilizing burnt apricot bones, chimney soot, gallnuts, gum arabic, river water, charcoal from ferns (collected on St. John's Eve), and vine charcoal (from a March full moon), culminating in a blood-based formula for writing pacts.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VII. De las oraciones y virtudes de los planetas
structure_content.summary: Introduces the concept of planetary hours, their dominion over specific days, and their corresponding virtues for various magical experiments (e.g., hidden treasures, communication with spirits, calling souls), with all major operations to be conducted at night.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VIII. Del modo de ejecutar los experimentos
structure_content.summary: Details the general procedure for conducting magical experiments, beginning with the consecration of instruments through a fervent prayer to Adonay, followed by specific instructions for the 'Flight Experiment' and 'Invisibility Experiment,' involving invocations to specific spirits and ritual acts.

structure_content.chapter_title: DE LA EXPERIENCIA DEL AMOR
structure_content.summary: Explains a love spell involving the creation of a wax or metal figure under Venus or Luna hours, inscribed with desires using a special quill and ink, and an invocation to love spirits and planetary kings.

structure_content.chapter_title: EXPERIENCIA DE GRACIA Y AGRADO
structure_content.summary: Describes a ritual to gain general favor or the affection of a specific person, involving writing an invocation to Adonay on virgin parchment during Venus or Luna hours, then folding and carrying it over the heart.

structure_content.chapter_title: EXPERIENCIA DEL ODIO Y DESTRUCCION
structure_content.summary: Outlines a destructive spell requiring a wax or clay figure of the target, ritually sprinkled and inscribed with names of harmful spirits, followed by an invocation for torment and curses, with clear instructions on how to later nullify the spell by burning the figure.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IX. Explicaciones útiles sobre los experimentos e invocaciones
structure_content.summary: Offers supplementary guidance on invocations, distinguishing optimal weather conditions for celestial (clear) versus terrestrial/infernal (stormy) spirits, and discussing the varied forms spirits may take and their cardinal residences.

structure_content.chapter_title: TALISMANES. CAPITULO PRIMERO. De los Talismanes
structure_content.summary: Introduces talismans as magical objects (stone, metal) inscribed with celestial seals, tied to planetary metals and influences. Provides an overview of famous talismans (Solomon's Ring) and the specific virtues associated with talismans of each planet.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO II. Talismanes imantados
structure_content.summary: Explains the creation of magnetized talismans, formed from seven planetary metals and consecrated with lodestone, for attracting desires. Describes their ritual preparation, including offerings to the planets, and their use for business, travel, love, and combat.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO III. Gran talismán Dominator o la llave de los pactos
structure_content.summary: Details the 'Key of Pacts' or Dominator talisman, attributed to Solomon, for subjugating spirits. It describes its construction from specific metals, its consecration with lodestone and invocation to divine and angelic forces, and its ritual upkeep.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IV. Donde se demuestra el poder y virtudes del Talismán llamado 'El Dragón Rojo'
structure_content.summary: Recounts the legendary origin and power of the 'Red Dragon' talisman, given by Solomon to Hiram Abid, which grants command over numerous spirits, reconciliation, respect, wisdom, youth, wealth, and long life through daily invocations and offerings.

structure_content.chapter_title: EL ANILLO DE SALOMON
structure_content.summary: Describes the crafting and consecration of Solomon's Ring, made of pure gold with an emerald and celestial engravings under specific astrological conditions, used for gaining dominion, intelligence, and prosperity through invocations.

structure_content.chapter_title: GRAN TALISMAN DE CONSTELACIONES
structure_content.summary: Instructs on creating a Grand Talisman of Constellations, made of seven planetary metals under specific astrological conditions, imbued with power through invocations to Venus for success, power, and glory.

structure_content.chapter_title: TALISMAN CELESTE
structure_content.summary: Details the creation of a celestial talisman, similar to the Constellations talisman but gold-dominant, consecrated at dawn on Sunday with invocations to the Sun for general efficacy.

structure_content.chapter_title: TALISMAN EXTERMINADOR
structure_content.summary: Describes the creation of the Exterminator Talisman, primarily lead, made on a Saturday night under a full moon. It is highly potent against evil spirits, granting the wielder power, obedience, and protection, even from demonic possession.

structure_content.chapter_title: TALISMAN DE ISIS
structure_content.summary: Focuses on the legendary 'clover of four leaves' talisman associated with the goddess Isis, explaining its fabrication from silver and platinum on a Monday night under a full moon, and its use for attracting happiness, fortune, health, power, and love.

structure_content.chapter_title: Talismanes Ordinarios
structure_content.summary: Mentions a mercurial talisman (green/red metal) for protection and obedience from spirits. Also, various Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars talismans, specifying their colors, metals, and effects like calling spirits, preventing earthquakes, knowing treasures, and granting invulnerability in battle.

structure_content.chapter_title: LA CLAVÍCULA DE SALOMÓN O EL SECRETO DE LOS SECRETOS. INTRODUCCION
structure_content.summary: Presents Solomon's teachings to his son Roboan, emphasizing that true wisdom cannot be simply transmitted but requires merit. Introduces talismans made of silver, copper, and brass, to be blessed and exorcised, for granting love and other desires.

structure_content.chapter_title: EXPLICACIONES UTILES SOBRE TALES TALISMANES. CAPITULO VI. De los Amuletos Mágicos
structure_content.summary: Elaborates on Paracelsus's theory of planetary-metal correspondences and their use in talismans. It stresses the importance of the operator's virtue and modesty for a talisman's efficacy. It also introduces amulets as protective devices, citing their use by Moses and Solomon.

structure_content.chapter_title: DEL MODO DE PREPARAR LOS AMULETOS
structure_content.summary: Details the elaborate Arabian method of preparing amulets, involving virgin parchment, ink mixed with virgin priestess' blood and sacred plant sap, and mineral inks. These are consecrated on sacrificial altars, folded with Quranic verses, and perfumed.

structure_content.chapter_title: AMULETO CONSTELADO
structure_content.summary: Describes the creation of a 'Constellated Amulet' on virgin parchment, featuring zodiac signs, planetary names, and metals inscribed with specific inks, with the Sun image at its center, to be crafted over planetary hours for general efficacy and protection.

structure_content.chapter_title: AMULETO EVANGELICO
structure_content.summary: Introduces a Christian amulet, a small book containing the four gospels, to be read and blessed by a priest with exorcised water. It is sewn into a child's clothing for protection against malevolent influences, sortileges, evil eye, and incurable diseases.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VII. De la manera de lograr que los amuletos y talismanes posean virtudes y eficacia
structure_content.summary: Instructs on empowering talismans and amulets through a 30-night ritual of exposure to the stars from 10-11 PM, accompanied by a specific prayer to 'sovereign stars' to imbue the object with virtues for dominion, wealth, protection, and wisdom.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VIII. El espejo secreto dé Salomón
structure_content.summary: Details the construction of Solomon's secret mirror over 48 days (new moon to full moon), using a polished steel plate inscribed with divine names. Rituals involve laurel charcoal, perfumes, and specific invocations to Azrael to reveal hidden truths.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IX. Nigromancia o arte de evocar a los muertos
structure_content.summary: Explores the art of necromancy for consulting the dead, citing ancient Greek practices and historical accounts like Saul and Samuel. The method involves Solomon's ring, prayers to God, and conjurations over a cadaver.

structure_content.chapter_title: INVOCACIONES, PACTOS Y EXORCISMOS. AL QUE LEYERE.
structure_content.summary: Emphasizes the critical importance of purity, faith, and temerity for successful invocations, warning against the dangers of fear and weak will when interacting with supernatural entities.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO PRIMERO. De los espíritus en general
structure_content.summary: Classifies spirits into a hierarchy (Supreme, Superior, Intermediate, Inferior) and by nature (Celestial, Aerial, Terrestrial, Infernal), explaining their distinct functions, attributes, and roles in the universe, noting the complementary nature of good and evil.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO II. DE LA JERARQUJA DE IOS ESPIRITUS. El Espíritu Supremo
structure_content.summary: Describes the Supreme Spirit as the eternal, infinite, and omnipotent Creator, the source of all life and being, beyond human comprehension, from whom all other spirits derive.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO III. Espíritus Superiores
structure_content.summary: Lists and depicts the hierarchy of superior celestial spirits (Adonay, Eloim, Jehován, Mitraton, Azrael, Astroschio, Eloy, Milach, Ariel, Zenaoth) and their specific roles and attributes, emphasizing their absolute obedience to the Supreme Creator.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IV. De los espíritus celestes
structure_content.summary: Details the seven planetary governors (Aratón, Bethor, Phaleg, Och, Hageth, Ophiel, Phul) and their unique powers, such as transmutation, conferring dignities, ensuring peace, granting health, beauty, and influencing metals.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO V. Los gnomos
structure_content.summary: Defines gnomes as elemental spirits of the earth (and air), guardians of treasures, and influential forces on human thought and emotion. It posits them as crucial intermediaries for transmitting human petitions to higher spirits and balancing influences.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VI. De lo infinito
structure_content.summary: A philosophical digression on the concept of the infinite in matter and space, describing the universe as populated by various elemental beings: sylphs (air), undines (water), gnomes (earth/metals), and salamanders (fire), each aiding philosophers and the wise.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VII. Jerarquía completa de los espíritus infernales
structure_content.summary: Outlines the comprehensive hierarchy of infernal spirits, starting with Lucifer, Belzebuth, and Astaroth. It lists six grand generals (Lucifugo Rofocal, Satanachia, Agalireth, Fleuretty, Sargatanas, Nebiros) and 18 subordinate spirits, detailing their respective powers and domains.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VIII. En que se trata de las invocaciones
structure_content.summary: Explores the seven greatest secrets revealed by spirits (healing, longevity, commanding elementals, universal understanding, life's purpose, spiritual identification, divine protection) and underscores the importance of clearly defining the desired secret and target spirit for each invocation.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IX. Invocación a los gnomos para que se muestren propicios
structure_content.summary: Provides a specific prayer and ritual for invoking gnomes to act as benevolent intermediaries, transmitting the operator's petitions to higher celestial or infernal spirits, ensuring their favorable reception and aid.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO X. Invocación a los espíritus celestes superiores
structure_content.summary: Presents a fervent, four-night prayer to the Supreme Creator, Adonay, Eloim, and Jehován, culminating in a vision of the angel Azrael, who appears to grant wisdom and guidance based on the operator's spiritual worthiness.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO XI. EL SANCTUM REGNUM. Verdadero modo de hacer pactos con los espíritus infernales sin sufrir ningún daño
structure_content.summary: Describes the detailed, multi-step ritual for making a pact with infernal spirits without harm. This involves preparing a consecrated space, using specific magical instruments, drawing a cabalistic circle, and performing a powerful invocation and negotiation sequence with Lucifugo Rofocal, secured by a blood-signed pact.

structure_content.chapter_title: GRANDE INVOCACION A LOS ESPIRITUS CON QUIENES SE DESEA HACER PACTO SACADA DE LA GRAN CLAVICULA DE SALOMON
structure_content.summary: Provides the exact, forceful invocation to Lucifer, Belzebuth, and Astaroth to compel Lucifugo Rofocal to appear and agree to a pact for desired riches and benefits, emphasizing the power of Solomon's Clavicle.

structure_content.chapter_title: APARICION DEL ESPIRITU
structure_content.summary: Details the direct dialogue with Lucifugo Rofocal during a pact ritual, including the spirit's initial demands for the operator's soul for twenty years, the counter-offer, and the subsequent agreement for immediate treasure in exchange for monthly offerings and limited summoning.

structure_content.chapter_title: CONJURO Y DESPEDIDA AL ESPIRITU CON QUIEN SE HA RECIBIDO PACTO
structure_content.summary: Instructs on the precise conjuration to dismiss Lucifugo after a pact, commanding him to depart without noise or ill odor, and reinforcing the pact through Solomon's Clavicle, followed by a thanksgiving prayer to God for the successful operation.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO XII. Conjuracion y pacto con Lucifer para pedirle cuanto se desee
structure_content.summary: Outlines a direct and audacious pact with Lucifer, Luzbel, and Satanás, bypassing lesser spirits, to acquire profound magical knowledge, wealth, power, love, invisibility, and control over natural phenomena, explicitly involving the offering of the operator's soul.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO XIII. Que trata de los exorcismos y el modo de conocer si una persona padece de hechizos o enfermedad natural
structure_content.summary: Explains how to diagnose whether an ailment is caused by natural illness or demonic possession. Provides an initial prayer and hand placement ritual to discern the spirit's nature and determine if an exorcism is necessary, followed by specific exorcism formulas for individuals, houses, and natural phenomena.

structure_content.chapter_title: SEGUNDA PARTE. El Dragón Rojo y La Cabra Infernal
structure_content.summary: This section introduces the legendary 'Red Dragon' and 'Infernal Goat' as central figures in this magical tradition, detailing their historical significance and powerful magical properties.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO PRIMERO. El dragón rojo de Moisés y Salomón
structure_content.summary: Narrates the mythical origin of the Red Dragon talisman, traced back to Moses and Solomon, highlighting its immense power to command spirits and influence destiny, obtained through specific daily invocations and offerings of camphor.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO II. Adivinación por medio de los cuerpos Celestes o astrología
structure_content.summary: Discusses the ancient science of astrology, detailing the influences of planets (Sol, Luna, Marte, Mercurio, Júpiter, Venus, Saturno) and zodiac signs on human destiny, character, and events, including methods for creating horoscopes.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO III. Visiones y apariciones
structure_content.summary: Explores the phenomena of visions and apparitions, distinguishing between natural and provoked manifestations of deceased loved ones, saints, or evil spirits. It emphasizes the role of powerful will and concentrated imagination in inducing these experiences.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO IV. La cabra infernal
structure_content.summary: Describes the Infernal Goat as a symbolic form taken by diabolical spirits during invocations, emphasizing its representation of perfidy and deceit. It advises the magician to be fearless and prepared with protective instruments and talismans.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO V. Transformaciones de la materia
structure_content.summary: A digression into the philosophical and scientific understanding of matter, its indestructibility, atomic composition, and the generation of life, linking these concepts to the broader mysteries understood through occult wisdom.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VI. Del éxtasis o abstracción
structure_content.summary: Analyzes the phenomenon of ecstasy or trance, attributing it to the magnetic influence of spirits and cerebral exaltation. It describes the physical and mental states of individuals experiencing ecstasy, including insensitivity to pain and hallucinatory experiences.

structure_content.chapter_title: CAPITULO VII. Por qué permite Dios que el demonio atormente a las criaturas
structure_content.summary: Explores the theological reasons for divine permission of demonic torment, framing it as a means for correction, purification, and demonstrating God's power and justice.

key_concepts.definition: The comprehensive art and science to gain absolute dominion over spirits, elements, and hidden knowledge, based on ancient Hebrew and Egyptian wisdom, revealed by infernal spirits to initiates like Jonas Sufurino and Solomon.

A hierarchy of entities encompassing both celestial (e.g., Adonay, Eloim, Jehován, Azrael, who guide and protect) and infernal (e.g., Lucifer, Belzebuth, Astaroth, Lucifugo Rofocal, who offer wealth, power, and secrets in exchange for pacts) beings.

A magical object, often crafted from specific metals or stones, inscribed with cabalistic signs, planetary symbols, and divine names, imbued with particular virtues (e.g., wealth, protection, invisibility, love) through planetary influences and conjurations.
Protective magical items, generally simpler than talismans, used to ward off diseases, malefices, and negative influences. They can be personal items, written prayers, or small consecrated books.

A formal agreement, typically with infernal spirits, where the operator offers their soul (often conditionally or after a set period) in exchange for specific material gains, knowledge, or powers. It requires precise rituals, specialized instruments, and unwavering courage.

A powerful magical text or specific talisman (referred to as the 'Dominator') that grants the practitioner control over spirits and the ability to unlock all secrets, representing a foundational element of Solomonic magic.

A powerful talisman, historically associated with Moses and Solomon, granting dominion over spirits, wealth, wisdom, protection in conflicts, and other profound benefits through specific daily invocations and offerings.
A symbolic form taken by diabolical spirits during invocations, embodying perfidy and deceit, against which the magician must be prepared and fearless.

Elemental spirits primarily associated with the earth (and also air currents), described as guardians of both material treasures and human intelligence. They influence thoughts, emotions, and intuition, and serve to transmit human petitions to higher spirits.
The ritual process for expelling malevolent spirits from individuals, dwellings, or even natural phenomena like storms, achieved through the use of divine names and specific conjurations.

The ancient science of divination and influence through the study of celestial bodies (planets and zodiac signs). It details the impact of planetary conjunctions and positions on human destiny, character, and the timing of magical operations.

The act of calling upon spirits (celestial, infernal, or elemental) to appear, provide assistance, or reveal secrets. It necessitates specific preparatory rituals, consecrated locations, and precise prayers or conjurations.

practical_system.description: The book outlines a comprehensive system of ceremonial magic, focusing on spirit invocation and pact-making. It details the preparation of the magician (moral purity, mental focus, specific attire), the ritual space (devoid of religious symbols, often isolated, near natural elements), and the magical tools. The core operations involve a hierarchical approach to spirits (celestial, elemental, infernal), with specific conjurations and offerings tailored to each. Pacts with infernal entities like Lucifer and Lucífugo Rofocal are central, offering wealth, power, and knowledge in exchange for the magician's soul (often conditionally). Protection is afforded through talismans and divine names. The system is highly prescriptive, emphasizing meticulous adherence to instructions, planetary timing, and the practitioner's inner state.
tools: Magical knives (white-handled for Jupiter, black-handled for Saturn), consecrated with animal blood (topo) and plant juices (pimpinela).
Sword, dagger, lancet, and needle, consecrated under specific planetary influences (Mars, Mercury).
Magical staves (walnut) and wands (hazelnut or wild reed), consecrated under solar/Jupiterian influences with invocations.
Quills from male auca (eagle-owl) or swallow's right wing, consecrated for writing magical texts.
Special ink made from charcoal (apricot bones, fern, vine), chimney soot, gallnuts, gum arabic, river water, and the practitioner's blood.

Talismans: Solomon's Ring (gold, emerald, Hebrew names), Red Dragon (seven metals, camphor offerings), Dominator (gold, brass, bronze, lodestone), planetary talismans (specific metals, colors), Constellated Amulet (parchment, zodiac symbols, planetary inks), Exterminator Talisman (lead, scorpion, crosses), Isis Talisman (silver/platinum, clover).
Amulets: various forms, including the 'Amulet of the Gospels' (small book of gospels).
Ritual attire: White linen undergarment, black fine wool tunic and hood, embroidered with Hebrew characters and divine names in red silk, white lambskin shoes.
Consecrated items: lodestone, blessed candles, verbena/basil/elder crowns, red/green silk bags, new plates for charging talismans.
rituals: Invocation of celestial spirits (Adonay, Eloim, Jehován, Azrael) for wisdom, guidance, and favor, often involving four-night prayers and perfume offerings.
Invocation of Gnomos to act as intermediaries for petitions to other spirits.
Ritual for acquiring the 'gift of flight' involving specific invocations and sword gestures.
Ritual for achieving 'invisibility' through invocations to various spirits and the use of the magical sword and consecrated wine.
Love spells utilizing wax/metal figures, specific inks, and invocations to Venusian spirits and cardinal kings.
Destructive magic (hate spells) involving effigies, cursed inscriptions, and invocations to harmful spirits, with instructions for reversal.
Necromancy for consulting the dead, requiring Solomon's ring and specific conjurations over a cadaver.
Direct pacts with Lucífugo Rofocal for treasures, involving a blood-signed pact, specific conjurations, and monthly coin offerings.
Direct pacts with Lucifer for occult knowledge, power, and abilities, involving a formal invocation and a conditional soul offering.
Exorcism of persons possessed by spirits, utilizing prayers to God, San Cipriano, and superior spirits, with ceremonial use of holy water and crosses.
Exorcism of houses afflicted by troublesome spirits, involving conjurations and crosses with the white-handled knife.
Exorcism against hailstorms and hurricanes, using conjurations and four-directional cross gestures with the white-handled knife.

relevant_quotes.text: Aquí os presento un libro de un valor inestimable, el "Tratado completo de la verdadera Magia", escrito por el monje alemán Jonás Sufurino.

El que tenga fe y temeridad, llegara a conseguir el dominio de las cosas maravillosas; pero el que sea temeroso y apocado de ánimo, se expone a ser atormentado y mortificado, sin conseguir beneficio alguno.

¡Oh, gran Lucífugo! Yo te ruego que dejes tu morada, donde quiera que te halles, para venir a hablarme; de lo contrario, te obligaré por la fuerza del grande y poderoso Alpha y Omega, y de los ángeles de luz, Adonay, Eloim, y Jehován, a que me obedezcas.
La cruz es un amuleto que inutiliza en absoluto la operación mágica mejor.
Yo prometo al gran Lucifugo recompensarle durante veinte años de todos los tesoros que me conceda. En fe de lo cual lo firmo. N. N.

critical_analysis.relevance: El Libro de San Cipriano is a quintessential grimoire, deeply entrenched in the Solomonic tradition but heavily syncretic, integrating Christian and Old Testament figures (Solomon, Moses, St. Cyprian) with explicit demonolatry (Lucifer, Belzebuth, Astaroth) and planetary magic. Its significance lies in its detailed, operative instructions for pacts and conjurations, solidifying its place within the historical lineage of forbidden magical texts. It directly references elements found in other notable grimoires like 'The Grand Grimoire' and 'The Black Pullet,' positioning itself as a comprehensive compendium within this specific magical current. The text's emphasis on the practitioner's moral and spiritual state (faith, courage, purity) alongside precise material preparation (instruments, talismans, inks) aligns with Hermetic principles, even when dealing with infernal entities. The concept of spirits granting wisdom and knowledge, not just material gain, is a recurring theme in esoteric literature.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The target audience for 'El Libro de San Cipriano' is explicitly defined as initiates and aspiring magicians ('novicios' to 'maestros') seeking to acquire practical magical results. This includes individuals desiring wealth, love, invisibility, protection, dominion over others, and even the ability to harm enemies or engage in necromancy. The text strongly warns that only those with 'true vocation,' 'absolute faith,' 'unwavering will,' and 'temerity' (fearlessness) should attempt its practices, as fear or lack of resolve can lead to torment or failure. It is intended for practitioners committed to the operative side of magic, willing to follow meticulous instructions and engage directly with various classes of spirits, including those from the infernal hierarchy, with full awareness of the potential consequences.
